description: Maps Azure policy summaries and Microsoft Defender for Cloud assessments to SOC 2 Type II, ISO/IEC 27001:2022, and PCI DSS v4.0.1 controls.

SOC2.name: SOC 2 Type II
SOC2.description: Trust Services Criteria for Security, Availability, and Confidentiality

CC6.1.name: Logical and Physical Access Controls
CC6.1.description: The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets
azurePolicySummaries: Require multifactor authentication for owner accounts
Network security groups should protect virtual networks
Storage accounts should restrict public network access
defenderAssessments: Identity and Access: MFA should be enabled on accounts with owner permissions

CC6.6.name: Logical and Physical Access Controls - Encryption
CC6.6.description: The entity implements encryption to protect data at rest and in transit
azurePolicySummaries: Storage accounts should use customer-managed keys for encryption
Transparent Data Encryption on SQL databases should be enabled
Web apps should only be accessible via HTTPS
defenderAssessments: Data security: Enable encryption at rest
Secure transfer to storage accounts should be enabled

CC7.2.name: System Monitoring
CC7.2.description: The entity monitors system components and the operation of those components
azurePolicySummaries: Azure Monitor log profile should be enabled
Diagnostic logs in Azure resources should be enabled
Activity log retention should be set to at least 365 days
defenderAssessments: Enable Microsoft Defender for Cloud for all eligible resources

CC7.3.name: System Monitoring - Incident Response
CC7.3.description: The entity evaluates security events to determine whether they could impact the system
azurePolicySummaries: Security contact email address should be configured
Security contact phone number should be configured
defenderAssessments: Security alerts: Ensure alert notifications are routed

A.9.2.1.name: User registration and de-registration
A.9.2.1.description: A formal user registration and de-registration process shall be implemented
azurePolicySummaries: Remove deprecated accounts with owner permissions
External accounts with owner permissions should be removed
MFA should be enabled on accounts with owner permissions

A.12.6.1.name: Management of technical vulnerabilities
A.12.6.1.description: Information about technical vulnerabilities shall be obtained in a timely fashion
azurePolicySummaries: System updates should be installed on virtual machines
Vulnerabilities in security configurations should be remediated
Vulnerability assessment should be enabled on SQL servers

A.12.4.1.name: Event logging
A.12.4.1.description: Event logs recording user activities shall be produced and kept
azurePolicySummaries: Audit logging should be enabled on SQL servers
Diagnostic logs should be enabled on Key Vault
Resource logs in Azure Stream Analytics should be enabled

A.18.1.3.name: Protection of records
A.18.1.3.description: Records shall be protected from loss, destruction, falsification and unauthorized access
azurePolicySummaries: Geo-redundant backup should be enabled for Azure Database
Long-term geo-redundant backup should be enabled for SQL databases
Soft delete should be enabled for Azure Storage

PCIDSS.name: PCI DSS v4.0.1
PCIDSS.description: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard

1.2.1.name: Network Security Controls
1.2.1.description: Configuration standards for network security controls are defined and implemented
azurePolicySummaries: All network ports should be restricted on network security groups
Internet-facing VMs should be protected by network security groups
Subnets should be associated with a Network Security Group

2.2.2.name: Vendor Default Accounts
azurePolicySummaries: Accounts with owner permissions should have MFA enabled
Guest accounts with owner permissions should be removed

8.3.1.name: Multi-Factor Authentication
8.3.1.description: MFA is implemented for all access to the CDE
azurePolicySummaries: MFA should be enabled on accounts with write permissions
MFA should be enabled on accounts with read permissions

10.2.1.name: Audit Logs
10.2.1.description: Audit logs are implemented to support detection of anomalies and suspicious activity
azurePolicySummaries: Activity log should be retained for at least 365 days
Diagnostic settings should be enabled on critical resources
